III.	Facility Identification
The Armour-Eckrich facility is located at 2001 Summit Avenue in Hastings, Nebraska. The facility is engaged in processing meats such as meat patties, meatballs, sausage links, and bacon strips. Many areas of the plant are refrigerated to preserve the meat products.

The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. There is one refrigeration system onsite that is used for refrigerating meat products. The amount of ammonia currently present in the refrigeration system is approximately 68,000 pounds, which is above the minimum threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds.

VII.	Five-Year Accident History
The Armour-Eckrich Meats facility has not had an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage in the last five years.

rich Meats LLC has an Emergency Response Plan (ERP), updated on September 30, 2007, to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release. Response activities will be coordinated with the Adams County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and the Hastings Fire Department (which includes a HAZMAT Team). This coordination effort includes providing the fire departments with site diagrams and hazardous material information, meeting with fire department personnel to discuss facility operations/processes, and periodic on-site inspections by fire department personnel.

The facility maintains an ERP on file at the plant. According to the ERP, facility employees are responsible for investigating and assisting the fire department (if necessary) with response to accidental releases of ammonia. The plan includes annual training of all employees on evacuation procedures and emergency notification procedures. The plan also includes annual training for emergency response team members. It identifies the Emergency Response Coordinators, Evacuation Coordinators, and alternates. In addition to the facility ERP, the plant is included in a community emergency response plan developed by the Adams County Local Emergency Planning Committee. Armour-Eckrich Meats coordinates with the Hastings Fire Department (which includes a HAZMAT) on emergency response activities. 

The facility has two windsocks present onsite for use in determining wind direction in the event of an ammonia release. One is located at the east side of the plant at the north side of the truck parking lot, and the other one is located at the southwest corner of the plant.
